p: The code to simulate the model was written in C++, with data analysis performed in C++, Mathematica 11.3 [ 38] and R, and visualization using gnuplot and R. During the analysis, it was necessary to find peaks in individual time series data. For this, a duplicate time series was created and smoothed using Wiener filtering [ 39]. This smoothing was necessary due to the natural stochasticity of individual runs of the model. This smoothed time series was then analyzed using FindPeaks in Mathematica 11.3 [ 40]. The peaks were then mapped back to the original time series and checked for accuracy.
